Chapter 3 Model half In this chapter we sample the selected model with half data 3.1 Data dist_edge <- 20 n_census <- 10 n_ind_species <- 10 Table 3.1: Metrics on inventory data used to fit the full model including sample size (N), memdian, minimum and maximum values for families, genera, species, individuals, observations, cenusus, recruitment year (year0), last censused year (yearmax), recruitment diameter (dbh0) and last censused diameter (dbhmax). N Median Minimum Maximum families 48 genera 150 species 275 individuals 4 218 observations 91 002 census 24 11 31 year0 1 989 1 984 2 010 yearmax 2 019 1 994 2 021 dbh0 13 5 88 dbhmax 19 6 96 3.2 Model Using time \(t\) since recruitment (DBH=10cm) for each individual tree \(i\) in species \(s\): \[ DBH_{t,i,s} \sim \mathcal N (10 + gmax_i \times \sum _{y=1 | DBH_{1,i} = DBH_{recruitment}} ^{y=t} exp(-\frac12.[\frac{log(\frac{DBH_{t,i}}{100.Dopt_s})}{Ks_s}]^2)), \sigma)\]
